main event: On March 5, 1953, unidentified flying objects were reported near Congaree AFB and Shaw AFB in South Carolina, observed by military personnel and tracked by radar.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be triangular with three lights on each point, capable of high-speed maneuvers., The initial sighting involved attempts to scramble jets to intercept the objects but they were unsuccessful., Radar operators at Congaree AFB were able to lock onto the objects, estimating their speed at 600-700 mph., Multiple witnesses, including airmen and radar operators, confirmed seeing the objects., The report eventually classified the sighting as unidentified after investigation.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects (triangular in shape with lights)
witness description: military personnel including radar operators and airmen
